results.title: Through conflict to negotiation
results.creator_credit: Peter Pearson, Bonnie Sherr Klein, John Kemeny, Barrie Howells and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Challenge for change”
A community action group in Rochester, New York, confronts the community’s largest employer on the issue of corporate responsibility and the employment of minority groups.

results.title: Crystals and their structures
results.creator_credit: Quentin Brown and Chemical Education Material Study Education Services
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Chemical Education Material Study Series”.
Crystals have plane faces, sharp edges, sharp melting points, and may cleave easily to give new plane surfaces. They also interact with x-rays to produce well-defined diffraction patterns. Experiments are performed in a ripple tank on an unknown crystalline array so that the student sees the principles and measurements by which actual crystal structures are determined. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Would I ever like to work
results.creator_credit: Kathleen Shannon, Len Chatwin and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Challenge for change/Societe nouvelle”.
Joan is a welfare mother with seven children. Originally from the Maritimes, she now lives in Montreal. She would like to work as a waitress, and feels she’d be a better mother if she could. But day care costs more than she can afford.

results.creator_credit: Laurence Hyde, Jim MacKay, Cine-Photographie and National Film Board of Canada

Episode number 1 of Series “Chants populaires”.
Animated scenes illustrate two French folk songs. ‘En roulant ma boule’ 2.50 mins. ‘A la claire fontaine’ 1.39 mins. Featuring the Alouette Quartet.

results.title: C'est l'aviron
results.creator_credit: Norman McLaren and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Chants populaires”.
A short animated version of a French folk song. McLaren used gouache drawings which he superimposed against a scenic background to give the impression of a boat travelling along a lake and river which he acheived by zooming during the photographic process.

results.title: Two union leaders talk about workers and health
results.creator_credit: Boyce Richardson, Andy Thomson and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Challenge for change/Societe nouvelle
Jim Fill, director of legislation and community affairs of the United Auto Workers in Canada, and Dave Patterson, president of local 6500 of the United Steelworkers of America in Sudbury, Ontario, describe briefly how workers are trying to get more control over conditions in their places of work. Patterson says that the worker used to have only two rights: the right to disease and the right to death. However, progress is slowly being made. In two provinces the worker now has the legal right to refuse a job which the worker considers hazardous.

results.title: Bromine - Element from the sea
results.creator_credit: J. Arthur Campbell, David W. Ridgway and University of California, Los Angeles
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Chemical Education Material Study Series”.
Experiments show the great reactivity of bromine with metals and non-metals, giving products readily soluble in water. A procedure is developed for the extraction of bromine from a dilute sodium bromide solution such as sea water.

results.title: Equilibrium
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Chemical Education Material Study Series”.
Deals with three questions: What is chemical equilibrium? How does the chemist recognise it? How does he explain it? In answering the questions the film stresses the dynamic nature of equilibrium. An Analogy in terms of fish population in two connected bowls, and animation using molecular models, present the concepts. Suitable for upper secondary level.

Episode of Series “Chemical Education Material Study Series”.
Deals with three questions: What is chemical equilibrium? How does the chemist recognise it? How does he explain it? In answering the questions the film stresses the dynamic nature of equilibrium. An Analogy in terms of fish population in two connected bowls, and animation using molecular models, present the concepts. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: High temperature research
results.creator_credit: David W. Ridgway, Arthur Campbell and Centron Production
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Chemical Education Material Study Series”.
The procedures for producing and measuring temperatures in the region of 2000 degrees are shown. Also studies the bond strength of gaseous titanium monosulphide and shows how its gaseous molecules as well as gaseous titanium and sulphur atoms are produced by the vaporisation of the high melting crystalline titanium monosulphide at this temperature.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David W. Ridgway, Arthur Campbell and Centron Production
